cyclone.name: HENRI
cyclone.current_location: about 320 miles SSE of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northward and then north-northeast toward southern New England
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern New England (Long Island eastward to Rhode Island)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from New Haven, CT to Sagamore Beach, MA including Long Island; Tropical Storm Watch westward to New York City
weather_observation.warning_coast: None yet – watches only (storm-surge and hurricane watches for portions of Long Island and southern New England)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Mid-Atlantic coast from Cape May, NJ northward through New England and Atlantic Canada
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds 25–40 mph possible Sunday as Henri’s outer bands pass east of Delaware Bay
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal surge of 1–2 ft possible along the Delaware Bay and tidal Delaware River
weather_observation.rainfall: Widespread 1–3 inches with locally higher totals in bands Sunday into Monday
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along Delaware and New Jersey beaches
